text:
I downloaded Apache 2.2 two weeks ago - no problem. Somone has changed something and now there is no ZLIB.DLL but a ZLIB1.DLL.

These were the mirrors I used.

http://apache.mirror.aussiehq.net.au/ 
http://apache.wildit.net.au/
creator: john@vk5ajl.com

text: Problem is with SSL version only. I got the non-ssl version going fine.
creator: john@vk5ajl.com

text:
The name of the zlib DLL has been changed by the zlib project from zlib.dll to zlib1.dll long ago. See:

http://www.zlib.net/DLL_FAQ.txt

Apache 2.2 binaries for Windows always shipped with zlib1.dll.

I'm closing this issue, because it seems your questions are more appropriate for the user discussion list.

If you are really convinced there's a bug here, you can reopen the issue. Dont' forget to provide the following information:

- what exactly was the file you downloaded two weeks ago
- what exactly was the download file that you think is broken now
- provide md5 checksums for those files
- If you try to compile yourself, what are the steps you do
- What do you mean by "no go at all"? Which configuration did you use? Anything in the error log?

Regards,

Rainer
creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
